explanation: To determine whether ahc_echo violates the MISRA rule forbidding direct or indirect self-calls, you must inspect the entire call closure reachable from ahc_echo. The list contains (a) all functions ahc_echo calls directly and (b) the immediate callees of those functions as shown in the provided static call graph. Each listed symbol is required because its implementation may contain calls that continue the call chain; any such call could eventually lead back to ahc_echo and thus create indirect recursion. The next analysis step should examine the bodies (or further call edges) of these symbols to see whether any path returns to ahc_echo. Examining only ahc_echo is insufficient because recursion can occur via intermediate functions (e.g., ahc_echo -> MHD_queue_response -> ... -> ahc_echo).
